TopicTitle: Stayputnik: The first object in space!

Articles.Content:
I know about F2, I just took a screenshot I already had and messed around with it for fun.

Edited August 26, 2013 by GregroxMun

Ok no offense but that could use some work, you applied way too much noise to it, just duplicate the original layer apply all the noise you can then change the opacity to around 10-20, also i think you forgot to press F2.

Edited August 25, 2013 by Capn
I just took a screenshot and messed around, I didn't take the pic with this in mind.
F2 to get rid of user interface.

The noise on your image is a little harsh. I'd recommend duplicating the layer, applying all the noise you want, and then lightly blurring the whole thing. Then, reduce the noisy layer's opacity to whatever you'd like, and it'll give you a more authentic looking effect.
